Docs.summary: Represents errors that occur when validating properties of a dynamic data source.
Creates a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "DefaultMessageDisplayedByParameterlessCtorWriterMustSupply". This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a specified message that describes the error.

remarks.format:

|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed
Public Sub New (message As String, innerException As Exception)

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EntityDataSourceValidationException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/docs/standard/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property InnerExceptions As IDictionary(Of String, Exception) Implements IDynamicValidatorException.InnerExceptions

Docs.summary: Gets the exceptions that occur when a new or edited data field is validated.
Docs.value: A collection that contains all the exceptions that occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EntityDataSourceValidationException> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicValidatorException> interface.
